admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Third Jiangxi Highway
            Project for China were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory; the risk to development outcome was low or
            negligible; the Bank's performance was satisfactory;
            and the Borrower's performance was highly satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: The benefits of technical
            assistance can be enhanced through the conduct of seminars.
            The well attended seminars, where study objectives and
            recommendations were presented and discussed by a large
            number of stakeholders, is likely to have a significant
            impact; first, by making those responsible for implementing
            the recommendations get a good understanding of such
            recommendations; and second, by extending the range of
            stakeholders, both direct and indirect, who have a clear
            grasp of the study topics, their importance, and ways to
            improve performance. Implementation of rural roads
            components requires close cooperation between provincial and
            local government authorities. Highway projects can, during
            implementation, generate important social benefits, through
            well designed and implemented social policies. Project
            development objective (PDO) indicators shall be selected
            carefully to provide meaningful feedback on project
            performance. In various highway projects, one of the PDO
            indicators is to reduce number of accidents and fatalities
            over the monitoring period of the projects.
